page.title: 08Entertainment In South Kyme
page.content: Apart from clubs, villagers find entertainment out of the village:- cinemas or theatres in local towns. The Football Club and W.I. organise dances. The W.I. has an Amateur Dramatic Group, which usually produces an annual comedy play. For home enter- tainment, many people own televisions and radios, with a few owning video recorders and computers. BBC Radio Lincolnshire is heard by many. {CUSTOMS:}Feast week is the first week in November. The W.I. organise a Chine Supper every Kyme Feast. Chine is a joint of bacon, stuffed with chopped parsley, and is a traditional Lincolnshire dish. Most families, until recently, fed and killed a pig each year for food. A dole for the poor and needy of the village, left by a man called Marmaduke Dickinson, is handed out by the vicar at Christmas.
